text.section: There is a Lead Hazard Reduction Grant Program.

The Department may make a grant solely to finance a lead hazard reduction activity that:
is a program that tests innovative or unproven methods of lead hazard reduction; or
is in a residential property in an area designated by the Department to have a concentration of:
families of limited income; and
residential property constructed before 1950; or
children diagnosed with elevated blood lead, which is a quantity of lead in their blood, expressed in micrograms per deciliter (µg/dl), that exceeds a specified threshold level.

section.section: The Department may establish standards to determine the eligibility of a lead hazard reduction activity for a grant under the Grant Program.

The standards may call for consideration of:
the extent to which the lead hazard reduction activity benefits families of limited income;
the need and circumstances of the owner-occupants or tenants of the residential property in which the proposed lead hazard reduction activity will be undertaken; and
whether the grant finances research into innovative or unproven methods for lead hazard reduction.

text.section: In determining whether to make a grant under the Grant Program, the Department shall require that the owner of the residential property or child care center submit evidence that the owner cannot undertake lead hazard reduction activity without a grant.
The Department may require that all or part of a grant under the Grant Program be repaid when conditions specified by the Department occur.
